III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & R 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
1

(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth
on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date, Staff 4 was restraining Youth A and choked
her. Youth A did not report, nor have visible injury. Youth A was
hospitalized for suicidal ideations from 2/10/25-2/17/25. The
incident occurred before this date.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was contacted via phone on 2/21/25. Complainant
reported that the youth does not want to be at the facility and has
been hospitalized multiple times due to making suicidal ideations
and has said it is because she wants to leave.
Youth A was observed by the consultant at the facility on 3/3/25
and on 3/5/25. Youth A was escalated and unable to be
interviewed.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/25/25.
Youth B reported she never saw staff inappropriately restrain or
choke Youth A. Youth B reported that Youth A said she wanted to
hurt herself and went to the hospital. Youth B reported she never
saw Youth A with any marks or bruises or hearing that any staff
harmed her during a restraint.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/25/25.
Youth C reported she remembered that Youth A was restrained
one time a couple of months ago. Youth C reported that Youth A
had threatened self-harm and the other youth were removed from
the wing so nothing was witnessed. Youth C denied knowledge of
or witnessing Staff 4 ever choking or improperly restraining Youth
A or any other youth.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/25/25.
Youth D denied witnessing Youth A be restrained or being
choked. Youth D denied witnessing marks on Youth A. Youth D
reported that she witnessed and heard Youth A causing clears on
the wing before by yelling, throwing stuff, and breaking objects.
Youth D reported that Youth A did not wish to return when she left
the facility to go to the hospital and has heard Youth A say that
she does not want to be at the facility.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/25/25.
Staff 3 reported that the incident occurred on C wing in Beata Hall
on Superbowl Sunday. Staff 3 reported that staff was attempting
to hold group on the wing when Youth A began cussing and
2

saying she wanted to leave. Staff 3 reported they attempted to
redirect and give another youth a chance to speak when they
began arguing with one another. Staff 3 reported Youth A
approached the other youth and staff called a clear to separate
them and remove the other youth from the wing. Staff 3 reported
all other youth were moved from the wing when Youth A
attempted to push past staff and enter other youth’s rooms. Staff 3
reported that staff stood in front of the youth’s doorways to prevent
Youth A from entering. Staff 3 reported Youth A began pushing
staff to attempt to get past them. Staff 3 reported staff attempted
verbal redirection by asking Youth A to stop. Staff advised Youth
A that if she continued to push staff that they would have to
manage her. Staff 3 reported that a two person CPI hold was done
at that time with himself and the supervisor on either side of Youth
A. Staff 3 reported that when Youth A dropped to the floor staff
released her. Staff 3 reported Youth A attempted the same thing
on the other end of the wing by pushing staff and she was again
placed in a two person hold, dropped to the floor and was
released. Staff 3 reported from the floor Youth A began swinging
and hitting staff and had hit Staff 5 in his private area and he had
to move off the wing due to his injury. Staff 3 reported that Youth
A began kicking and kicked Staff 3 in his private area. Staff 3
reported that those who restrained Youth A in the hallway were
Staff 3, Staff 4, Staff 5, and Staff 7. Staff 3 reported that Youth A
began to calm down and staff continued to attempt verbal
redirection as Youth A went into her room. Staff 3 reported staff
stayed on the outside of the room standing at the door speaking to
her. Staff 3 denied that any staff entered the room other than to
retrieve a plastic piece she was trying to self-harm with and
denied that Youth A was restrained again by Staff 4 or any other
staff. Staff 3 denied that Youth A was choked at any time by Staff
4 or any other staff. Staff 3 denied Youth A complaining during the
escalation of being in pain or being choked. Staff 3 reported that
while youth A was in the room she was sitting against the wall and
attempting to self-harm with an object she was hiding from staff.
Staff 3 reported that police were called, arrived and entered the
room at which time Youth A stood up and put her arms out to be
cuffed.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/25/25.
Staff 4 reported that the incident occurred on C wing. Staff 4
reported when he approach to provide assistance Youth A had
been pushing at staff to try to get past them into other youth’s
bedrooms. Staff 4 reported he assisted in moving the other youth
off of the wing and returned to provide further assistance by
switching out with Staff 5 after he had been injured. Staff 4
reported that Youth A was placed in multiple two person hold
restraints on either end of the hall and she would drop at which
3

time staff would release. Staff 4 reported that when released
Youth A would kick and punch from the floor, come up to her feet,
take swings at staff, and begin pushing again. Staff 4 denied any
injuries occurred to Youth A during the restraints and denied
Youth A complaining of any pain or injury during or after the
restraints. Staff 4 reported that throughout the escalation staff
attempted verbal redirection to attempt to calm Youth A. Staff 4
reported that Youth A had calmed down and gone into her
bedroom and was sitting on the floor with staff outside the door
speaking with her. Staff 4 reported that no staff entered the room
and a restraint did not occur while Youth A was in the room. Staff
4 denied choking youth A and denied that any other staff choked
Youth A at any time. Staff 4 reported that Youth A attempted to
self-harm while in the bedroom with her fingernails and with a
piece of black plastic, so police were called. Staff 4 reported that
Staff 3 was able to get the piece from her. Staff 4 reported Staff 3
did enter the room to get the plastic piece and came back to the
doorway to await police. Staff 4 reported that police came and
when they arrived Youth A stood up and put her arms out to be
cuffed. Staff 4 reported that the other staff present were Staff 5,
Staff 6, Staff 7, and Staff 3.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/25/25.
Staff 5 reported he heard commotion on C wing and came over to
assist. Staff 5 reported when he approached staff were redirecting
the other youth off the wing to deescalate Youth A. Staff 5
reported Youth A was trying to push through staff to get into other
youth’s rooms. Staff 5 reported Youth A was restrained multiple
times during this on either side of the wing as she attempted to get
into different bedrooms by pushing and hitting staff. Staff 5
reported Youth A was put in multiple two person holds and was
released when she dropped to the floor however when released
would kick and swing at staff, hitting multiple staff including
himself in the private area. Staff 5 reported that when he was hit
he switched out with Staff 4. Staff 5 reported that he did not see
anything after he was switched out to tend to his injury. Staff 5
denied Staff 3 or any other staff choked Youth A during the
restraints he was present for. Staff 5 reported that Youth A likes to
go to the hospital because she does not like to be at the facility.
Staff 5 reported that the other staff present were Staff 4, Staff 6,
Staff 5, and Staff 3.
Staff 6 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/25/25.
Staff 6 reported that Youth A was restrained multiple times on C
wing in Beata Hall and that staff present were Staff 3, Staff 4, and
Staff 5. Staff 6 reported that Youth A got into an argument during
group and began to escalate at which time the other youth were
removed from the area. Staff 6 reported that youth A was
4

restrained when she attempted to push through staff to enter other
youth’s rooms. Staff 6 denied any staff including Staff 4 choking
Youth A during any of the restraints. Staff 6 reported that Youth A
was put in restraints with two people on either side and staff let go
when dopped to the floor. Staff 6 reported Youth A was hitting,
pushing, kicking, and punching all the staff and hit multiple staff.
Staff 6 denied ever hearing Youth A complain of being in pain
during the incident. Staff 6 reported
Staff 7 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 2/25/25.
Staff 7 reported Youth A was restrained multiple times in two man
CPI holds due to Youth A pushing, punching, and kicking at staff
attempting to get past them and into other youth’s bedrooms. Staff
7 reported that Youth A did not complain of any pain during the
incident and that no staff caused injury to her including choking.
Staff 7 denied witnessing Staff 4 choke or otherwise improperly
restraining Youth A. Staff 7 denied that any restraints occurred in
the youth’s bedroom. Staff 7 reported that when Youth A calmed
she went into her bedroom and threatened self-harm so police
were called and staff observed her outside the door until they
came. Staff 7 reported that Staff 3, Staff 4 Staff 5, and Staff 6
were present and she timed the restraints. Staff 7 reported once
the restraints were over she left the wing and denied any
restraints occurring in the bedroom.
Video Review:
Video footage from 2/9/25. Video footage shows multiple two
person holds with Youth A. Video shows Youth A pushing,
striking, and kicking staff from the floor and standing. Video shows
staff outside bedroom door until police arrive. The video does not
show any staff with their hands on or near Youth A’s neck at any
time.
Documentation reviewed:
MDHHS Specialist Notes from her interview with Youth A:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at Beaumont Hospital by the
MDHHS Specialist on 02/20/2025. There were no injuries
observed on Youth A. Youth A reported that she was trying to self-
harm with a piece of plastic and that she gave it to Staff 4 when he
asked for it. Youth A Youth A reported that Staff 4 grabbed her by
the side of her neck and threw her down to the ground. Youth A
reported that this was not the first time Staff 4 attempted to choke
her. Youth A was not sure when the other time was but said
maybe 3 months prior. Youth A reported that the incident occurred
on super bowl Sunday around 5:30PM. Youth A reported that the
incident occurred in the hallway of C wing. Youth A reported no
other youth were present because they were all trying to jump her
5

so they were escorted away. Youth A reported she has never
observed Staff 4 harming any of the other youth.
Incident report (IR) #2749. IR details Youth A being placed in
multiple CPI two man restraints as a result of attempting to push
through staff into the bedrooms of other youth. IR details staff 4,
staff 5, staff 7, and staff 3. IR details that police were called to the
scene and youth A was escorted out.
Analysis No rule violations are established regarding the allegation. It was
consistently denied by all staff who were present that any choking
occurred during the incident by staff 4 or by any other staff. It was
further denied that any restraints occurred in the youth’s bedroom
while awaiting arrival of police. It was confirmed via video footage
that no choking or other inappropriate restraint activity occurred
during the escalation. It was further supported by interviews with
staff and youth that youth A frequently says that she does not
want to be at the facility and says she wants to go to the hospital.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
